column1: Grading Policy This course will adopt the following grading scale: A = 90 -100 B = 80 -89 C = 70 -79 D = 60 -69 F = <60 The grading will be based on textbook discussion

column1: The weights of the activities and the correspondent policies are as follows: Activity % Policies Midterm Exams 35 Three midterm exams will be taken through the duration of the course
The materials covered in each exam will NOT be accumulative; the same topics will not be covered in two exams
The hi ghest score of the three exams will be worth 15% of the semester grade
The scores of the other two exams will each be worth 10% of the semeste r grade
